newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila sees 20 bln peso loss in new oil tax law.
newsitem.headline: Manila sees 20 bln peso loss in new oil tax law.

text.p: The Philippines is expected to forego over 20 billion pesos in revenues next year due to the recent restructuring of tariffs on oil products, a study made by the Department of Finance released on Tuesday showed.
The tax restructuring is part of the industry liberalisation moves. The government decided to reduce taxes and tariffs on crude and refined petroleum to keep domestic prices low.
The law took effect last August 16.
Based on the study, the Bureau of Customs is likely to lose 17.1 billion pesos next year from excise tax collection, while the Bureau of Internal Revenues, 3.0 billion pesos.
The study, however, said the losses were expected to be offset by higher import volume in the coming years as a result of the deregulation of the industry.
